title: Is Danny Miller leaving Emmerdale as Robert Sugden and Aaron Dingle flee?
text:
Are we about to see the last of Robron? (Picture: ITV/REX)

Robert Sugden (Ryan Hawley) is due to depart from Emmerdale this week as he flees from the law.

We know that vile Lee (Kris Mochrie) will have soon succumbed to the injuries inflicted on him by Robert.

This comes as a crushing blow to Robron, as Robert will find himself facing the prospect of spending a long time behind bars for the attack.

With Robert due to go on the run from the law, will Aaron (Danny Miller) be taking his leave of the dales for good?

Is Danny Miller leaving Emmerdale?

In upcoming scenes, Aaron will decide to leave Emmerdale with his husband.

However something will end up dividing the soulmates, and Aaron’s storyline could very well take a dark turn after he eventually ends up in Emmerdale without his love.

After Robert brutally attacked the evil Lee, his sister’s rapist, Lee ended up dying of his wounds.

Unable to face the prospect of going to prison, Robert will decide to go on the run and Aaron will opt to be by his side.

However, when they set their affairs in order and prepare to flee, the couple are hit by the gravity of what they’re about to do, and bidding goodbye to their loved ones will no-doubt prove a painful task.

We’ve known for months that actor Ryan Hawley, who’s played Robert Sugden since 2014, was due to depart from the soap this year.

On the subject of his character’s upcoming exit, Ryan said: ‘The news has just been broken to them so they haven’t really got a plan, they are going to have to take it as it comes. It means some very emotional goodbyes to some people in the village, but they have to be quick and there are some people they don’t even get the chance to because there just isn’t time.

‘The police are literally on their way so they have to be fast and quickly make it out of the village. They really believe they are going to stay on the run and make it work. There were very emotional goodbyes with a real sense of urgency.’

On being a part of the Emmerdale cast, he said: ‘I will miss the show massively, it has been a huge part of my life for the last few years. I love working here, I love the people that I work with and it’s going to be very emotional leaving.’
